note:
Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   M
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
Penicillins / beta blockers / Cephalosporins / I.V. contrast / 
morphine / gabapentin
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
Dyspnea, Lethargy
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None
 
History of Present Illness:
Mr. ___ is a ___ male with history of CAD ___ MI and
vfib arrest, HFrEF, COPD, lung cancer, on afib ___ PPM on AC and
CKD who presented with four days of fatigue, confusion, cough,
and decreased PO intake found to have pneumonia as well as HF
exacerbation and is being admitted for diuresis and antibiotics. 


Per ED notes pt was brought in by family after palliative care 
RN
noted that patient did not appear well, was lethargic and
confused with cough and decreased PO intake over the past few
days. On admission to the ED, he was noted to have an elevated
white blood cell count, chest x-ray showing pneumonia and
pulmonary edema, and elevated ___. He had a mildly elevated
troponin, however normal CK-MB and has baseline elevated
creatinine. In the emergency department he also endorsed
abdominal pain for which he received a NCCT. 

Pt was recently admitted in ___ for mitral clip for severe
mitral regurgitation after which he was discharged home. 
Notably,
patient is currently full code which was verified by his
healthcare proxy. 

In the ED:
- Initial vital signs were notable for: T99.7, HR 70, BP 125/59,
RR18, 99% on 3LNC
- Exam notable for: Exam notable for lethargy, disorientation,
inattention, asterixis. Elevated JVP. Decreased breath sounds at
bilateral bases. Systolic murmur at apex. 2+ BLE edema.
- Labs were notable for: WBC 13.9->11.3, H&H 10.9/34.6, plt 61.
Cr 2.2, ___ ___
- Studies performed include: CXR, NCCT head, CT abd and pelvis
w/o contrast

CXR
IMPRESSION:  
 Moderate pulmonary edema. 
 Posterior right upper lobe consolidation is worrisome for
pneumonia. 
 Marked enlargement of the cardiac silhouette. 
 Small bilateral pleural effusions. 

NCCT Head
IMPRESSION:  
Limited by patient motion artifact. Given this, no acute
intracranial process seen. 

NCCT Abdomen
IMPRESSION: 
 1. Interval increase in size of left pleural effusion, which is
now moderate in size. Interval development of small right 
pleural
effusion. 
 2. Interval increase in size of nonhemorrhagic pericardial
effusion, now moderate in size. 
 3. Severe cardiomegaly. 
 4. No evidence of organized fluid collections within the 
abdomen
or pelvis to suggest an abscess. 
 5. Similar appearance of extensive atherosclerotic disease of
the abdominal aorta and the origins of its major intra-abdominal
branches. 
 6. Similar appearance of a large staghorn calculus within the
left renal pelvis. 
 7. 1.3 cm nodular density adjacent to the right major fissure.
Recommend attention on subsequent imaging. 
 8. A large amount of stool is seen within the rectum. 

- Patient was given: 80mg IV Lasix x2, ASA, BB, apixaban,
olanzapine, duoneb, Abx: Vanc/cefepime/flagyl

- Consults: palliative care informed of pt

Vitals on transfer: 97.6, 135/69, 68, 18, 95% on 3LNC

Upon arrival to the floor, pt's spouse endorses history as 
above.
She adds that over the past few weeks pt has experienced
shortness of breath and ___ edema and she has been in contact 
with
both his cardiologist and pulmonologist. She feels that he has
more fluid on his legs and in his hands than is his baseline. 
She
additionally notes that over the past week and a half he has 
been
more confused than is his baseline, saying odd things that do 
not
pertain to the conversation at hand.He has also had increased
back pain iso missing physical therapy. After an appointment 
with
cardiologist last week had discussed having palliative care
nursing come to the home for support for spouse and patient. Was
prompted to come in by this nurse who felt patient did not look
well.   

REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Complete ROS obtained and is otherwise
negative.
 
Past Medical History:
Lung cancer (non-small cell lung cancer/SCC of the LUL)
COPD (emphysema) up to 3L
Atrial fibrillation ___ PPM
CHF (EF 35-40%), c/b severe MR
CAD ___ MI
Diabetes
Atypical mycobacterial infection (history of M. abscesses on
sputum culture ___  ___ abx treatment)
Hyperlipidemia
 
Social History:
___
Family History:
Mother: ___
Father: ___
 
Physical Exam:
ADMISSION PHYSICAL EXAM:
======================
VITALS:97.6, 135/69, 68, 18, 95% on 3L
GENERAL: Fatigued-appearing elderly male, alert and interactive.
EYES: NCAT. PERRL, EOMI. Sclera anicteric and without injection.
Bruise noted on left cheek
ENT: MMM. No cervical lymphadenopathy. JVD to mandible. 
CARDIAC: Soft/distant, difficult to appreciate above breath
sounds, irregularly irregular with SEM best appreciated at RUSB.
Audible S1, S2. No rubs/gallops appreciated
RESP: Course breath sounds bilaterally with audible breath 
sounds
when standing at bedside. Thick sounding cough not productive of
sputum. 
ABDOMEN: Normal bowels sounds, non distended, non-tender to deep
palpation in all four quadrants. No organomegaly.
MSK: BLE 2+ edema to the knees, no clubbing or cyanosis. Pulses
DP/Radial 2+ bilaterally. 
SKIN: Warm on exam. Cap refill <2s. No rash though multiple
scattered bruises noted over UE. 
NEUROLOGIC: AOx2 - to self and place. Oriented to Month but not
year. CN2-12 grossly intact. 
PSYCH: appropriate mood and affect though appears confused with
tangential speech and pointing at objects asking what they are

calTCO2-27 Base XS-1 Comment-GREEN TOP

MICROBIOLOGY:
============
___ Urine Culture:    URINE CULTURE (Final ___: 
      MIXED BACTERIAL FLORA ( >= 3 COLONY TYPES), CONSISTENT 
WITH FECAL
      CONTAMINATION.

___ Blood Culture: (Preliminary): No growth to date x 2
___ MRSA Nasal: No MRSA isolated

KEY IMAGING:
==========
___ CXR: Moderate pulmonary edema. Posterior right upper 
lobe consolidation is worrisome for pneumonia. Marked 
enlargement of the cardiac silhouette. Small bilateral pleural 
effusions.

___ CT Head w/o Contrast: Limited by patient motion 
artifact.  Given this, no acute intracranial process seen.

___ CT Abd/Pelvis without Contrast: 
1. Interval increase in size of left pleural effusion, which is 
now moderate in size.  Interval development of small right 
pleural effusion.
2. Interval increase in size of nonhemorrhagic pericardial 
effusion, now moderate in size.
3. Severe cardiomegaly.
4. No evidence of organized fluid collections within the abdomen 
or pelvis to suggest an abscess.
5. Similar appearance of extensive atherosclerotic disease of 
the abdominal aorta and the origins of its major intra-abdominal 
branches.
6. Similar appearance of a large staghorn calculus within the 
left renal pelvis.
7. 1.3 cm nodular density adjacent to the right major fissure.  
Recommend attention on subsequent imaging.
8. A large amount of stool is seen within the rectum.

___ TTE: 
The left atrial volume index is SEVERELY increased. The right 
atrium is moderately enlarged. There is a bidirectional color 
flow Doppler signal across the interatrial septum most c/w an 
atrial septal defect. The estimated right atrial pressure is 
>15mmHg. There is mild symmetric left ventricular hypertrophy 
with a mildly increased/dilated cavity. There is a small to 
moderate area of regional left ventricular systolic dysfunction 
with inferior and inferolateral hypokinesis (see schematic) and 
preserved/normal contractility of the remaining segments. 
Quantitative biplane left ventricular ejection fraction is 39 % 
(normal 54-73%). There is no resting left ventricular outflow 
tract gradient. Mildly dilated right ventricular cavity with 
mild global free wall hypokinesis. The aortic sinus is mildly 
dilated with a mildly dilated ascending aorta. There is a normal 
descending aorta diameter. The aortic valve leaflets (3) are 
mildly thickened. There is no aortic valve stenosis. There is 
mild to moderate [___] aortic regurgitation. A MitraClip 
prosthesis is present. The MitraClip is attached to both 
leaflets, with thickened leaflets and restrained leaflet motion 
and normal mean gradient. There is an eccentric, anteriorly 
directed jet of moderate [2+] mitral regurgitation. Due to the 
Coanda effect, the severity of mitral regurgitation could be 
UNDERestimated. The pulmonic valve leaflets are normal. The 
tricuspid valve leaflets appear structurally normal. There is 
moderate [2+] tricuspid regurgitation. Due to acoustic 
shadowing, the severity of tricuspid regurgitation may be 
UNDERestimated. There is moderate pulmonary artery systolic 
hypertension. There is a moderate circumferential pericardial 
effusion. In the presence of pulmonary artery hypertension, 
typical echocardiographic findings of tamponade physiology may 
be absent.
IMPRESSION: Moderate circumferential pericardial effusion. MIld 
to moderate regional left ventricular systolic dysfunction, c/w 
CAD. Mild right ventricular systolic dysfunction. Well-seated 
MitraClip with normal transmitral gradient and at least moderate 
eccentric mitral regurgitation. Mild to moderate aortic 
regurgitation. Moderate tricuspid regurgitation. Moderate 
pulmonary hypertension.

DISCHARGE LABS:
==============
Patient expired 
 
Brief Hospital Course:
Mr. ___ is a ___ male with history of CAD ___ MI and 
vfib arrest, HFrEF, COPD, lung cancer, on afib ___ PPM on AC and 
CKD who presenting with four days of fatigue, confusion, cough, 
and decreased PO intake found to have pneumonia and HF 
exacerbation admitted for diuresis and antibiotics.  He was 
aggressively diuresed with IV Lasix and treated with antibiotics 
for hospital-acquired pneumonia. He required escalating doses of 
IV Lasix with minimal output. Palliative care was consulted and 
on discussion with family, patient was ultimately transitioned 
to DNR/DNI with plans to go home with hospice. Given 
instability, patient was transferred to ___ and passed away on 
___ with family at bedside.

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
